intro: Eugenia rhombocarpa, commonly known as the red-leaf eugenia, is a small evergreen shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its elliptical, glossy, dark green leaves that turn reddish in autumn. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by edible, bright red berries. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
